|elevation_ft = <!-- Area/postal codes & others --------> |postal_code_type = Postal code |postal_code = |area_code = |blank_name = |blank_info = |blank1_name = |blank1_info = |website = [http://portal.veracruz.gob.mx/portal/page?_pageid=1645,1&_dad=portal&_schema=PORTAL&ciudad=30155 www.tantoyuca.gob.mx] |footnotes = }} '''Tantoyuca ''' is a city in the [[Mexican state]] of [[Veracruz]]. It is located in the state's [[Huasteca Alta]] region. It serves as the municipal seat of the surrounding [[municipality (Mexico)|municipality]] of [[Tantoyuca (municipality)|Tantoyuca]].
In the 2005 INEGI Census, the city of Tantoyuca reported a total population of 23,893.<ref>{{cite web|title=Tantoyuca|url=http://www.e-local.gob.mx/work/templates/enciclo/veracruz/municipios/30155a.htm|work=Enciclopedia de los Municipios de México|publisher=[[Instituto Nacional para el Federalismo y el Desarrollo Municipal]]|accessdate=6 November 2008|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070127023713/http://www.e-local.gob.mx/work/templates/enciclo/veracruz/municipios/30155a.htm|archivedate=27 January 2007|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Name== Tantoyuca comes from the [[Wastek language|Tenek]] ''tan-tuyik'', which means "place of wax."
==History== Tantoyuca was founded by [[Huastec people]] in [[Conquest of Mexico|pre-Hispanic]] times. It was conquered by the [[Mexica]] [[Aztec Triple Alliance|Triple Alliance]] in the late 15th or early 16th centuries. It was given town ''(villa)'' status on 12 April 1850 and city ''(ciudad)'' status on 25 July 1901.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== {{commonscat|Tantoyuca Municipality}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20081125092754/http://portal.veracruz.gob.mx/portal/page?_pageid=1645,1&_dad=portal&_schema=PORTAL&ciudad=30155 Tantoyuca] Web page of the Veracruz State Govt. Accessed 6 November 2008.
